- When placed on the machine with object 1 already present, the machine turned on.
- When object 1 was removed, the machine turned off even with object 7 present.
- This suggests object 7 alone cannot activate the machine, but can contribute when object 1 is present.

Given that blickets are defined as objects that can make the machine turn on (even if in combination), and object 7 does contribute to activation when combined with object 1, it should be considered a blicket.
